å¿ƒæƒ… is a noun that means mood, state of mind.Â â£

ğŸ’“ å¿ƒ means heart. It is a common character that can be found as a radical in many words, most of which are related to the heart and feelings.Â â£

As a radical,Â å¿ƒ can be written just like the character itself, but it will look a bit squashed! For example, in the words æƒ³ (xiÇng - think, want),Â æ¯ (xÃ­ - rest),Â æ„Ÿ (gÇn - feel),Â æ€ (sÄ« - think, consider), etc.Â â£

The second character in our word of the day, æƒ…, also has the å¿ƒ heart radical. In this case it means feeling, but it can also mean situation, as in the word æƒ…å†µ (qÃ­ngkuÃ ng - circumstances).Â â£

So, heart å¿ƒ + feeling æƒ… = mood, state of mind, because your mood depends on what your heart is feeling!â£

The first character æŠ± means â€˜holdâ€™, â€˜carry in oneâ€™s armsâ€™, and also â€˜to harbourâ€™. It is an HSK 4 word. It is quite easy to remember if you look at its two components.
